channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: College Protesters Make Divestment From Israel a Rallying Cry
item.description: The campaign is likely to have a negligible impact on the companies or Israel, but activists see divestment as a clear way to force colleges to take action on the issue.

item.title: Enduring Mayhem: Images From Year 3 of the War in Ukraine
item.description: A photographic chronicle of the third year of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

item.title: The university protests against Israel's action in Gaza are a defining moment for Gen Z
item.description: Many Gen Zers want their institutions to divest from Israel in light of the devastation in Gaza.

item.title: Dairy Cows Transported Between States Must Now Be Tested for Bird Flu
item.description: Since a new form of bird flu arrived in 2022, federal officials have sought to reassure Americans that the threat to the public remained low.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Hamas Releases Video of Injured Israeli American Hostage
item.description: The video appeared to be the first time that Hersh Goldberg-Polin, who was badly wounded in the Hamas-led Oct. 7 attack, has been seen alive since he was taken captive.

item.title: Biden administration’s ‘commonsense’ retirement rule could save workers $5 billion a year
item.description: “This rule ensures that advisors must put their clients’ interests front and center.”

item.title: Arizona Democrats Advance 3rd Attempt to Repeal 1864 Abortion Law
item.description: The almost-complete ban on abortions in the state could go into effect as soon as June 8 if not repealed, the state’s attorney general said.

item.title: Pedro Sánchez, Spain’s Leader, Considers Resigning as Wife Faces Inquiry
item.description: Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez suspended all public duties until Monday, after a judge ordered an inquiry into alleged influence peddling by Mr. Sánchez’s wife.

item.title: RE/MAX chairman shrugs off groundbreaking $418 million commissions settlement, saying realtors will adapt
item.description: "If you look at the oil embargoes, you look at 17% interest rates, you look at the 2007 financial crisis, realtors learn to adapt, change their sales, and continue to succeed,” RE/MAX cofounder Dave Liniger said.

item.title: Biden Signs a $95.3 Billion Aid Package for Ukraine, Israel and Taiwan
item.description: The $95.3 billion measure comes after months of gridlock in Congress that put the centerpiece of President Biden’s foreign policy in jeopardy.

item.title: The Only Girls’ Team in a Boys’ Soccer League Has Gone Undefeated
item.description: The Queens Park Ladies, an under-12 soccer team in Bournemouth, England, hopes to inspire younger girls to get into the sport after a dominant season against the boys.

item.title: 'We need to move fast'— Biden signs TikTok ban along with $95 billion war aid for Ukraine, Israel and Taiwan
item.description: “History will remember this moment," the president said.

item.title: Mayor Adams Walks Back Budget Cuts Many Saw as Unnecessary
item.description: The mayor released a revised $111.6 billion budget, which included $2.3 billion that would restore some funding for schools and cultural institutions.

item.title: Here’s How U.S. Aid to Ukraine Might Help on the Battlefield
item.description: Weapons from the support package, considered “a lifeline” for Ukraine’s military, could be arriving on the battlefield within days.

item.title: GM is on the rise—but for now, EVs are holding it back, not leading the charge
item.description: Strong quarterly earnings are countered by continued losses on EV production, but GM says its EVs will be profitable as soon as later this year.
